item.title: Why Facebook Changed Its Name to Meta?
item.description: When Zuckerberg started Facebook in the dorms of Harvard, he was a computer science student who was very interested in social issues like privacy and social movements. He and his friends used it to keep track of one another, but within a few years it became a tool of mass consumerism and media manipulation, and it attracted the attention of the political and media establishment. The result is the social network we all know today, which now serves to create and distribute images of and about what people want to be.
